column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Six more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.Another 1
column2: 291 cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column3: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 270
column4: 621 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.The latest figures show that there are 345 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column5: which is 13 fewer than Tuesday. There are 33 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column6: down one from Tuesday. Last updated 27 October at 14:25 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column8: 021 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Wednesday.A total of 1
column10: 821 people have received their second dose and 7
column11: 630 people have received their third dose.A total of 61
column12: 837 people have received their booster dose.Last updated 27 October at 14:25 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column15: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.Another 1
column16: 631 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Wednesday.There were 503 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals and 101 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units on that day.Last updated 27 October at 14:30.Source: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column18: 019 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3
column20: 890 people have received their second dose.Last updated 27 October at 14:30Source: Department of Health Ireland
